owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: DesignNote
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing notations made by NCI vocabulary curators. They are intended to provide supplemental, unstructured information to the user or additional insight about the concept.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: Contributing_Source
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property is used to indicate when a non-EVS entity has contributed to, and has a stake in, a concept. This is used where such entities, within or outside NCI, have indicated the need to be able to track their own concepts. A single concept can have multiple instances of this property if multiple entities have such a defined stake.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: Legacy Concept Name
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing a retired unique concept identifier created and stored as Concept Name by legacy EVS software. Use of these values was long discouraged, but continued as late as 2009 when creation of new values ceased and Concept Name was retired. Legacy values are intended solely to help resolve and update earlier coding.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: definition
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing the English language definitions of what NCI means by the concept. They may also include information about the definition's source and attribution in a form that can easily be interpreted by software.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: has exact synonym
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing a fully qualified synonym, contains the string, term type, source, and an optional source code if appropriate. Each subfield is deliniated to facilitate interpretation by software.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: ALT_DEFINITION
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing the English language definition of a concept from a source other than NCI.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: Semantic_Type
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property that represents a description of the sort of thing or category to which a concept belongs in the context of the UMLS semantic network.
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:NCIT_P98: In general, applying semantic types aids in allowing users (or computer programs) to draw conclusions about concepts by virtue of the categories to which they have been assigned. We use a set of semantic types developed for the UMLS Metathesaurus. There are currently 134 semantic types in the UMLS.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: in subset
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: An association that connects the concept defining a particular terminology subset with concepts that belong to this subset.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: code
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing a concept unique identifier within the NCI Enterprise Vocabulary Service's NCI Thesaurus.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: NCI_META_CUI
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing the concept unique identifier (CUI) for those concepts that appear in NCI Metathesaurus but not in the National Library of Medicine Unified Medical Language System (NLM UMLS).

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: Display_Name
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing an alternative Preferred Name for use in some NCI systems.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: Preferred_Name
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing the word or phrase that NCI uses by preference to refer to the concept.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: UMLS_CUI
owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A property representing the concept unique identifier (CUI) assigned by the National Library of Medicine (NLM). If a concept in any NCI-maintained knowledgebase exists in the NLM Unified Medical Language System (UMLS), NCI includes the NLM CUI among the information we provide about the concept.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pharmacodynamics
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The study of the biochemical and physiological effects of drugs and the mechanisms of their actions, including the correlation of actions and effects of drugs with their chemical structure, also, such effects on the actions of a particular drug or drugs.
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: Branch of pharmacology that studies reactions between drugs and living structures, including the physiological responses to pharmacological, biochemical, physiological, and therapeutic agents.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Medicinal Chemistry
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A chemistry-based discipline, also involving aspects of biological, medical and pharmaceutical sciences. It is concerned with the invention, discovery, design, identification and preparation of biologically active compounds, the study of their metabolism, the interpretation of their mode of action at the molecular level and the construction of structure-activity relationships.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Neuropharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A branch of pharmacology concerned with the effects of drugs on the nervous system.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The study of pharmacologic agents. This includes the preparation, compounding, and dispensing of drugs, as well as the characteristics and properties of drugs, their effects on the body, and how they are metabolized and eliminated from the body.
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: The study of the origin, chemistry, and uses of drugs and their effects on the body.
Science that deals with the characteristics, effects, and uses of drugs and their interactions with living organisms.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Clinical Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: Science that deals with the characteristics, effects, properties, reactions, and uses of drugs, particularly their therapeutic value in humans, including their toxicology, safety, pharmacodynamics, and pharmacokinetics (ADME).
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of pharmacology that studies the effectiveness and safety of drug treatment in humans.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pharmaceutics
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The science of preparing and dispensing drugs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Psychopharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The science concerned with drug action and its effect on cognition and behavior

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: Toxicology is the study of the adverse effects of chemical, physical or biological agents on people, animals, and the environment.
The study of poisons, including the source, effect, and treatment of poisoning. It is a branch of pharmacology (the study of drugs).
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Toxicology is the branch of pharmacology that deals with the nature and effects and treatments of poisons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Environmental Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A branch of toxicology concerned with the sources, transformations and effects on health of natural and synthetic chemicals that are present in the environment.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cardiovascular Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Cardiovascular Pharmacology; the study of the effects of drugs upon the heart or circulatory system
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: The study of the effects of drugs upon the heart or circulatory system.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pharmacology and Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The science concerned with drugs together with the science concerned with the detection, chemical composition, and pharmacologic action of toxic substances or poisons and the treatment and prevention of toxic manifestations.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cyclic Nucleotide Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The science concerned with the chemistry, actions, and uses of cyclic nucleoside monophosphates.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Genetic Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: The branch of toxicology that deals with adverse effects of chemical, physical or biological agents on genetic material.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Toxicology focusing on the effects of drugs on genetics material and the generation of mutations and cancer.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Immunotoxicology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of toxicology focusing on the effects of poisons on the immune system.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Inhalation Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of toxicology focusing on the health effects of inhaled poisons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Molecular Receptor Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of pharmacology that tries to understand drug effects by understanding the way that receptors interact with proteins and other molecules in signal transduction.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pesticide Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The toxicology of pesticides

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pharmacology, Biologicals
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The pharmacology of biologics.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pharmacology-Drug Structure
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The relation of a drug structure to its activity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Prostaglandin Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of pharmacology concerned with the chemistry, actions, and uses of prostaglandins.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pulmonary Pharmacology and Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A branch of pharmacology concerned with the effect of drugs on the lungs with an emphasis on the toxic effects of drugs on the lungs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Renal Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The science concerned with drugs and their actions and uses in kidney biology and the treatment of kidney disease.
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: The science concerned with drugs and their actions and uses in kidney biology and the treatment of kidney disease. (NCI)

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Analytical Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A quantitative analysis of a toxic substance.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Toxicology, Antidotes/Treatment
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The treatment or medication that can be administered to a person who has been exposed to a toxic substance

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Toxicology, Biologicals
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The study of the toxicology of biologics.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Toxicology, Non-Drug
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The toxicology of compounds other than those used for therapy.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Toxicology, Other
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: This term is used as a form filler when there is no appropriate Toxicology term available.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Molecular Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of toxicology that tries to understand the health effects of poisons by understanding the way that genes, proteins, and molecules interact.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Neuropharmacology and Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Research into the mechanisms of drug action and cellular neurotoxicity in brain cells.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pharmacogenomics
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The investigation of variations of DNA and RNA characteristics as related to drug response.
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: Science that examines inherited variations in genes that dictate drug response and explores the ways such variations can be used to predict whether a person will respond favorably, adversely, or not at all to an investigational product.
The study of how a person's genes affect the way he or she responds to drugs. Pharmacogenomics is being used to learn ahead of time what the best drug or the best dose of a drug will be for a person.
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P98: The term is applicable to activities such as drug discovery, drug development, and clinical practice. Drug response includes drug disposition (pharmacokinetics, PK) and drug effect (pharmacodynamics, PD). The term drug should be considered synonymous with investigational (medicinal) product, medicinal product and pharmaceutical (including vaccines and other biological products).The definition of does not include other disciplines such as proteomics and metabonomics.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Biochemical Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A branch of pharmacology that studies the biochemical mechanisms responsible for the actions of pharmacologic substances.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Biopharmaceutics
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The study of the physical and chemical properties of a drug and its dosage forms and study of the influence of formulation factors of the agent on the therapeutic activity of a drug product.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Central Nervous System Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the central nervous system.
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the central nervous system. (NCI)

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gastrointestinal Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the gastrointestinal system.
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the gastrointestinal system. (NCI)

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Reproductive and Developmental Toxicology
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: The branch of toxicology that deals with adverse effects of chemical, physical or biological agents on reproduction and development.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the nature and effects of poisonous substances on reproduction and development.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Respiratory Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the respiratory system. (NCI)
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the respiratory system.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Safety Pharmacology
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A branch of pharmacology that investigates the potential undesirable pharmacodynamic effects of a substance on physiological functions in relation to exposure in the therapeutic range and above. (safetypharmacology.org)
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: A branch of pharmacology that investigates the potential undesirable pharmacodynamic effects of a substance on physiological functions in relation to exposure in the therapeutic range and above. (safetypharmacology.org) (NCI)

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Toxicokinetics
owl:Class.obo:NCIT_P325: Evaluation of the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of a substance in relation to its toxicity in an animal.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the rate at which a substance will enter the body and what effects that substance will have on the body.
